2010â11 |- | align=center colspan="2" style="white-space: nowrap;"| |} '''The Dam Cup''' Is a five sport rivalry between the [[Portland State Vikings]] and [[Eastern Washington Eagles]]. The five sports competing for the cup are football, womenâs soccer, womenâs volleyball, womenâs basketball and menâs basketball. The annual football game is worth four points, the womenâs soccer match is worth one point, each womenâs volleyball match is worth two points for a total of four points possible, and each menâs and womenâs basketball game is worth two points for a total of four points possible in each sport, The total points possible are 17 which means that to win the cup a school would need to win at least 9 points. ==Rivalry history== The Dam Cup celebrates the friendly rivalry between the states of Oregon and Washington within the [[Big Sky Conference]]. The so-named rivalry refers to the four dams linking Oregon and Washington that one passes on the 339-mile drive from the Portland State campus to the Eastern Washington campus. Located along the Columbia River, they are [[Bonneville Dam]], [[The Dalles Dam]], the [[John Day Dam]], and the [[McNary Dam]].[http://www.inlander.com/spokane/blog-1486-psu-ewu-time-to-give-a-dam.html] ==Rivalry purpose== The purpose of The Dam Cup is to create a rivalry between Portland State University and Eastern Washington University and provide a sense of pride between alumni in the Portland and Spokane areas. Other goals include increasing attendance at events between both schools and building school spirit among each institutions' student body.[http://goeags.com/genrel/releases/10atDamCup] According the PSU's website, winning the Dam Cup is one of the schools' priorities.[http://www.goviks.com/news/2010/8/25/athletics_0825104016.aspx] The winner of the Dam Cup will possess The Dam Trophy acknowledging the achievement for the following year. ==The 2010-11 Dam Cup Series== Soccer - Oct. 8, @ PSU 3, EWU 0 - PSU leads 1-0 Volleyball - Oct. 9, @ PSU 3, EWU - PSU leads 3-0 Football - Oct. 30, EWU 50, @ PSU 17 - EWU leads 4-3 Volleyball - Nov. 6, PSU 3, @ EWU 2 - PSU leads 5-4 Womenâs Basketball - @ EWU 72, PSU 60 - EWU leads 6-5 Menâs Basketball - Jan. 8 @ PSU 74, EWU 58 - PSU leads 7-6 Womenâs Basketball - Jan. 27 @ PSU 77, EWU 70 - PSU leads 9-6 Menâs Basketball - Jan. 27 @ EWU 65, PSU 51 - '''PSU wins 2010-2011 series and Dam Cup 9-8''' ==Football Series results== ''Portland, OR State victories are shaded {{color box|#006633}} green.
